items.content:
This e-learning arrangement contains the information and course material for the Teachers training. The context of this training soil and fertilization is part of the (new)curriculum. These topics are used to learn to develop and implement practical teaching in this course.

The main goal of this course is to Improve practical education.

The training consists of 2 parts:

1 preparatory online training: basic knowledge about soil and fertilization and basic knowledge of teaching methodology

2 Three training days: Development and implementation of outcome based lessons and practice situations in the field

Schedule online preparatory training

date Online Remarks
Latest 23 Nov. Registration Sevia Ecopolis: registration
From 23 Nov - 4 Dec

- Refresher course soil

- Refresher course fertilization

- Course outcome based learnng

Participants can do the online training in their own time and pace.

For local support and local special arrangement, Ecopolis will be available
4 Dec Submitting assignments Deadline for completing all pre-training courses.

items.title: Outcome based learning unit: Soil fertility management and water conservation

items.content:
Training Goals:

- To be informed about out come based learning in relation to practical-oriented education.
- Can work with learning objectives (labor market needs) where knowledge and skills are combined.
- Can select teaching materials for both skills and knowled for OBL
- Can implement skills lesson in line with learning objectives in educational programs

heading.content: Introduction OBL and practice orientated education.

items.content: Getting acquainted with the implementation of VET education
Information on developed course structure:
The Learning unit is the starting point for the development and implementation of the educational program.
In the next assigment you are going to describe learning outcomes and learing objectives for a teacher preforming in out come base learning.
The lesson program is based on a learning unit. This is done by going through a number of steps.
To gain experience creating a lesson program: complete the following assignment.

heading.content: Structure and background for development of educational programme

items.content:
Goals:

- make education more practical
- improve the relation between professional practice and education based on professional profiles.
- transfer of knowledge and skills to (more complex) work situations
- including the business community in (parts of) the educational process

Principles for the development of the lesson program

  • Training program is based on learning units.
  • A learning unit is based on a curriculum module with a focus on professional practice in relation to the subject of the learning unit.
  • 1 semester contains 6 learning units.
  • Assessments are taken in a real professional situation.
  • Essential knowledge can be tested in a written assessment.
  • Training program: Outcome based learning based on learning outcomes and learning objectives/
  • Learning outcomes: related to reel job situations.

A learning unit has a fixed format and contains:
1. Context: The professional context in relation to the subject of the unit
2. Learning outcomes: The learner/student can perform the professional tasks related to the subject of the learning unit.
3. Assessments. The learner/student proves that he/she masters the learning outcomes.
4. Learning objectives: sub-goals that lead to the ability to implement the learning outcomes by learners/students. Learning objectives are described in a outcome based manner. ( not as knowledge and skills)

Learning outcomes can be defined in different ways. Often a learning outcome is based on a topic from the content of a curriculum. In this proposal, a learning outcome is based on multiple topics from the curriculum and is directly linked to the work situation. In the document below, the difference is indicated by means of an example.
The aim is to link education and the results of learning directly to professional practice

Definitions/example

Train 4 green jobs

Frequently used way of working with learning outcome

Learning outcome

Apply tillage and fertilization based on relevant soil test results, and soil properties, in preparation for the growing season

Student recognizes different types of soil

(learning objective in T4GJ learning unit

Curriculum content (concept Mama Julius)

Definition of essential nutrients
Macro and micro nutrients
Available forms of essential nutrients
Excesses and deficiency of Plant nutrients
Environmental Type of soil
Climate
Biosphere
Tillage
ph
Salinity Plant nutrient analysis
Importance of organic matter
Nutrient cycles
Importance of C:N. C:P and C:S ratios
Types of manures
Benefits and limitation of organic fertilizers
Crop residues as manures
Storage and pollution problems
Types and mount of fertilizer
Assessment of optimum rates
Fertilizer calculations
Shifting cultivation
ect.

Physical properties of soil

Assessment criteria
  • plan and carry out the tillage and fertilization a crop in area for a farmer.
  • take soil samples according to protocol
  • Use the resources and materials in the prescribed manner
  • Determine the soil type using a determination key

Essential basic knowledge can be additionally tested by means of written tests

Essential basic knowledge can be additionally tested by means of written tests

A learning unit is based on a module from the curriculum.
The learning objectives in a learning unit must cover all subjects described in the curriculum module. Often one learning objective will cover more topics.

items.title: Curriculum Module soil fertiliy management and water conservation
Learning unit Soil fertility management and water conservation

items.content:
Online meeting:

Q & A

Subjects:
- refresher course soil
- refresher cours fertilization

This training day focuses on developing the lesson plan for the learning goals for soil and how the actual lessons can be organized and implemented.

In the next assignment you will work out the lesson plan for the learning objectives for soil

items.title: Assignment Lesson plan soil ferlility management and water conservation

items.content: This part of the training focuses on offering practical skills in education.

The lesson plan indicates which teaching materials should be used to achieve the learning objectives and thus the learning outcomes in the lessons. In the following assignment you indicate how the teaching materials are applied.
This part of the training focuses on offering practical skills in education. Attention is also being paid to innovations in the field of soil sampling and analyzes
In the next assignment you will work out the lesson plan for the learning objectives for fertilization

items.title: Assigment lesson plan soil ferlility managment and water conservation
